bestBHT.bht: After the full nine months of Mary's pregnancy, she finally gave birth to a son, just as the angel had foretold to both Zacharias and Mary. (20 words)

Philip Schaff: Luke 1:57. Fulfilled. Evidently after Mary’s departure.
John Gill: The nine months, which is the full time of a woman's going with child, were now complete..." (24 words)
...and she brought forth a son, according to the angel's prediction both to Zacharias and Mary..." (20 words)

bhtAttempts.bht: After the full nine months of Mary's pregnancy, she finally gave birth to a son, just as the angel had foretold to both Zacharias and Mary. (20 words)
After Mary completed the full term of her pregnancy, she brought forth a son, in accordance with the angel's prediction to both Zacharias and Mary. (24 words)
After the completion of the nine months of pregnancy, Mary gave birth to a son, precisely as foretold by the angel to both Zacharias and Mary. (20 words)
The arrival of Mary's son marked the fulfillment of the complete term of her pregnancy, as the angel had predicted to both Zacharias and Mary. (19 words)
After the full time of her pregnancy had elapsed, Mary gave birth to a son, just as the angel had previously foretold to both Zacharias and Mary. (23 words)
